text:
Follow-up email sent to them. I think this will put us on a good path forward.

Hi Chris, Andrew, Eric,
Also looping in Melvis, Yiannis, and Amanda for broader context,
Having the benefit of thinking through it overnight, I've distilled key discussion items for committee-level review.

1. Eligibility of pre-launch featured apps
We were transparent in our application that the CBTC app is not yet live but is scheduled to launch over the coming weeks. However, you raise a fair point around eligibility.
Question: Should featured apps that are not yet live earn rewards? Or if not, should rewards be escrowed until launch?

2. Billing utility
DA's utility is very useful, but unfortunately it's $5 fee makes the model economically unviable as app rewards approach that threshold.
At the time, Eric confirmed that it’s acceptable to build our own billing system, which we did using a simplified design with lower transaction costs.
Question: Can we, and other teams, continue using custom billing systems? Or, is use of the DA Utility mandatory?

3. Customer use cases and review
See an attached customer list and pipeline. Our customers generally fall into four categories: traders, liquidity providers, app developers and distribution partners. Note that we offer various license types, including Holder and Minter (tiered on usage).

4. Our role as infrastructure
As an infrastructure provider, we enable other ecosystem participants to mint CBTC through our platform. Our goal is to support a broad range of downstream applications.
We'd love to understand how infrastructure apps are treated under the current and future reward frameworks. We enable, but don't directly execute, minting.

In the current Canton phase, app rewards still largely go to dashboards, block explorers, and validators. We're keen to help evolve the system toward rewarding usage that drives trading volume and economic activity. Appreciate the continued dialogue.
Best,
Aki

text:
*Takeaway:* It's likely that they would stop giving us app rewards until CBTC is live.

The best thing we can do right now is to give the Eng team heads-down time, so they can focus on shipping it.

text:
Hey,

I just released the Canton Billing Admin: <https://canton-billing-admin-bfaa44c93632.herokuapp.com/>

You can create clients and the canton billing will pick it up and work with it. But before you use it we should schedule a meeting so we can do it together just to see how it works so we can assist if anything is not working.

Please do not share the link, I'm working on the authentication.

text:
Hey team! Just to follow-up on the sales call discussion yesterday --

It's very possible that the Holder license will need to go away at some point. Canton could de-fund billing rewards. Or, DA could ask us to stop selling this license. Technically, you don't "need" a license to hold an asset on Canton.

For now, what I'd suggest is that we continue to sell Holder, but only alongside a Minter. So the customer could buy Minter, or Minter + Holder. But we probably shouldn't sell Holder by itself anymore.

For now, what I'd suggest is that we continue to sell Holder, but only alongside a Minter. So the customer could buy Minter, or Minter + Holder. But we probably shouldn't sell Holder by itself anymore.
